fields.description:
The XML snippet on

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Testing+XML

contains an "& #10 ;" (spaces added) XML character entity right after "($TYPE$)$EXPR$". Confluence doesn't escape the entity which results in the browser rendering the entity as a linefeed and not show the actual XML content. AFAIK the correct behavior would be to escape the entity so it's shown to the user as it appears in the XML source.

fields.description:
We use Confluence a lot to do "concept devleopment". However at some point in time, the concept becomes "official" in the way that it must be presented to our clients, send around in email. This also requires use to use version control.

We have a separate document management system for this task which works fine for us.
However we are currently forced to to cut&paste to get an appropriate presentation of the content. As the presentation also varies from client to client, I would like to ask for an RTF export of pages. Using easily createable styles, this would allow us to format the output as required without touching the document itself.
I am aware that this could be build using the XML export but I feeld a direct RTF export would be more convenient.
fields.summary: Export pages to RTF

fields.description:
You can refer to #CSP-173 created at support.atlassian.com   Essentially we were not able to restore a Confluence installation using only the following
1) The contents of the CONFLUENCE_HOME folder
2) SQL database dump of the database we were using (mysql)

Our users put in a lot of attachments and we are worried about the size of the data being backed up.  We have arranged for the contents of CONFLUENCE_HOME to be backed up daily.  It looks like a SQL dump will not work because some strange Hibernate stuff goes on and it also looks like it is only possible to restore the database from the "entities.xml" file.

Once we found that the confluence "backup" task crashed the JVM and once there was an out of memory error.  We now have 80MB+ attachments and it is growing fast.

Solution:
a) give an option for only the entities.xml file to be generated as part of the daily backup or the manually triggered backup task.  Thus, if the user is backing up his attachments folder /CONFLUENCE_HOME on a regular basis, he will be able to restore.  Also, provide a Confluence "restore" task to take only the "entities.xml" file as an input, assuming the user has set up the CONLFUENCE_HOME correctly

b) or make it possible for a manual database (SQL) backup to work - but I would really prefer option a
fields.summary: Should be able to restore from Database dump + attachments dump

fields.description:
When you search for words in Confluence that contain characters which are not letters, these are stripped out by the tokeniser when performing a search.

This means such searches sometimes do not return any results or return results that do not really match the search criteria.

Some example searches that don't work properly: 

* C++
* MySQL 4.x
* 5.3.7
* MPEG-LA

fields.description:
Lotus Notes client ignores the stylesheet embedded into an HTML notification e-mail and shows the style definitions instead.

I fixed it by adding comments inside the <STYLE> element. Here is how my /WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/html/includes/header.vm looks like:

Skipped ...
    <base href="$baseurl" />
    <style type="text/css"><!--
    $stylesheet
--> </style>
Skipped ...

Is there any chance for it to get into the next release?
fields.summary: Email template fix for Lotus Notes 6.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1675].
  {panel}

Hello,

We don't use Confluence (yet) so apologies if this is already on the cards but I couldn't find it via searching.

Once documentation has been entered on the wiki, it often gradually becomes more and more obsolete over time.  To combat this, it would be nice to set up some kind of review mechanism whereby the author could choose to be notified in, say, 6 months' time that he needs to review the page.  

I just happened across a whole load of stuff I wrote ages ago in serious need of updating, so I thought this might be a useful feature to consider in choosing to use Confluence over some other content management systems.

Cheers,

  Mike

fields.description:
A small bug in the template system prints out (to the client) the Velocity macro name instead of calling it. In browseusers.vm at around line 77 one reads:

... <a href="$req.contextPath/display/~doubleUrlEncode($user.name)"> ...

while it should be

... <a href="$req.contextPath/display/~$!generalUtil.doubleUrlEncode($user.name)"> ...

Changing the line fixes the problem.

1] a problem on MailNotificationQueueItem.java:55 to do with the way the equality is being checked:

if (getMimeTypeForUser(user).equals(MIME_TYPE_HTML))

You alwasy want to do CONSTANT.equals(blah) - because it can never be null.

The root cause of the NPE is to do with the fact, obviously, that the call to getMimeTypeForUser(user) is returning null.
NB: We are using external user management (Jira).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1660].
  {panel}

Confluence uses a number of HEAD/patched versions of open source libraries for which there are no source downloads.

Most are date/timestamped versions - however, for many customers, especially us, its not possible to get the src from CVS due to firewall restrictions. And CVSGrab doesnt do date-based checkouts.

Can we please either :
a) Use only official versions of libraries, OR
b) Make the src available for download for each and every non-official version of a library.

Cheers,
Nick

Refer to JRA-2586 for the same problem with Jira.
fields.summary: Make library src available for download
Anchor links don't work in exported PDF's
Zipped exports created on a Windows Confluence instance are not platform-independent

fields.description: We post our specifications to Confluence, which requires a lot of images from Photoshop. It would be great if Confluence enabled the adding of attachments from the clipboard in the same way that JIRA allows for attaching screenshots.
fields.summary: Image attachments a la JIRA

fields.description: When creating a page with an embedded image, it is somewhat annoying to have to first create the page, then attach the image. What I usually do is include the image in the page (which results in an error on the page), then attach the file after I've created the page. While this works, I'm not able to see the page and how it will look before I actually commit the change. One possible solution is to allow for attaching a file during editing. If the page is eventually created, the file is committed. If the page is not created, the file is deleted from the server.
fields.summary: Can't attach file while editing page

fields.description:
The only way I can find to delete a blog entry is by clicking on it via the Recently Updated list in the Space Summary.  This is the only way I can get the edit and delete icons to appear.  Judging from the links generated, it looks like most of the ways of getting to a blog entry show the entries for a certain day and not a specific entry.

It would be nice to have at least a link on each individual blog entry that would take you to the edit/delete page for that entry, or even better, to have icons associated with each entry for the entry creator and space admins.

I could be wrong about this, but I spent hours trying to figure this out and this is all I could come up with.
fields.summary: Make blog entries easier to delete for admins

fields.description:
Currently, we have 9 colour settings that make up a colour scheme for a space - which is fine for the default look & feel of Confluence.

However, once you start customising the root decorators, you need to be able to refer to additional colour settings in order to make any new colours customisable at the space level.

To illustrate with an example:
We want to add a new panel at the root decorator level for a LHS nav-bar (it #includes a page called "Navigation").
However, people at the space level will want the nav-bar colours to match their space's colour scheme. There currently arent enough colour settings to be able to do this nicely. (Trying to re-use to existing colour settings usually makes it ugly)

So, a way around this is to be able to define custom colour settings - which can be referred to in the stylesheet velocity. 
OR, to add a fixed number of custom colours "Custom Colour 1", "Custom Colour 2", etc which can be used in the velocity.
fields.summary: Ability to add extra colour settings to a colour scheme

fields.description:
We are really finding Confluence useful and would like to know if we can import a huge set of documents that currently reside in our legacy Knowledge Management system.

1) Is it possible to programmatically upload a large set of documents?  If you can give me any pointers on how to get started or sample code - would be great.

2) Do you see any issue with pushing about 3 GB of documents into Confluence?  Have you any installations that have comparable volumes of attachments?  Would the Confluence backup work okay in such a situation?

3) If we do this programmatically, we would like to retain the folder hierarchy and map this to a Page hierarchy.  However we understand that you cannot have more than one Page with the same name within a space.  Do you have any suggestions on how best to work around this problem?
fields.summary: Bulk upload of Documents

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1648].
  {panel}

MySQL users will see the following console output on restarting the server: 

alter table SPACEPERMISSIONS add index FKD33F23BEB2DC6081 (SPACEID), add constraint FKD33F23BEB2DC6081 foreign key (SPACEID) references SPACES (SPACEID)
2004-08-05 15:28:41,892 ERROR [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: alter table SPACEPERMISSIONS add index FKD33F23BEB2DC6081 (SPACEID), add constraint FKD33F23BEB2DC6081 foreign key (SPACEID) references SPACES (SPACEID)
2004-08-05 15:28:41,892 ERROR [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] Invalid argument value,  message from server: "Duplicate key name 'FKD33F23BEB2DC6081'"

This error is completely harmless, and should not be marked as "error". It is simply reporting that a database operation that is undesirable (adding duplicate indexes) has not succeeded.

It would be ideal nonetheless to remove these messages from the console so that users do not get the impression that something is still "wrong" when they startup Confluence.
fields.summary: MySQL duplicate index error messages on startup

fields.description:
In the help tips (VIew Space Permissions), it seems like there's an inconsistency.

Extract:
----
These permission types are available:
# View Space: user can view space details and view and edit its pages.
# Leave Comments: user can leave comments with existing pages.
# Modify Space: user can edit pages in a space, add and remove pages, delete comments and upload attachments.
# Administrate Space: user can set permissions for the space, and edit the space's description.
----

It seems like the View Space permission should be changed into

user can view space details and view its pages.

Otherwise it conflicts with modify space. 

Note: I haven't tried to edit pages on a confluence install where users are only given the VIew Space permission. I am maybe wrong. But if I am, please tell me why both the View Space and the Modify Source permissions allow one to edit a space.

fields.description:
When a template is created within Confluence, variables are created by getting nested inside the @ symbols. It then spots the variables and replaces them as appropriate. However, it runs into several serious problems when you attempt to make a template that's anything more than cut-and-dried.

The following commands (and more) run into trouble when used with a variable

Inline Pictures
-The picture will be displayed, but only if the variable is set in another location. There's no way to display a specific picture without a dummy spot to load the variable, which clutters the page space
Ex:
!@MyPict@!
won't work until you also have 
@MyPict@ somewhere else on the page

Mailto: 
Ex:
[mailto:@CustEmail@] Displays a nasty line of confusing entry boxes which cannot be filled by a user. This confuses users who are filling in the template.
Once again, the use of a dummy location to fill in the data solves the problem, but creates clutter on the page.

Links
Ex:
Associated with Project: [@ProductName@|@ProductPage@|The @ProductName@ Page]
Confluence is smart enough to catch the @ProductName@ variable, but misses the other two entirely, creating an error. Once again, a series of dummy locations to fill in the data would work, but would add to page clutter and be extremely undesirable.

A system needs to be in place whereby a user only has to fill in the appropriate variables and upload the needed files for a page to be properly created. When Confluence reads through a template and fails to catch variables within the markup, it creates headaches for web developers and end users.
fields.summary: Templates fail to spot variables in links, mailtos, etc.

fields.description:
Confluence seems to be lacking in markup for the tab character. This makes the creation of aligned sets of data with anything but tables (complicated) and lists (unnecessary bullets) very complicated if not impossible.

i.e., take this list as follows

Customer Name:  Bob
Phone Number:   XXX
Address:        Carlotta Drive

If I want all of the information to line up, it becomes very hard to implement (Confluence steals away the extra spaces), and it should be something I don't even have to think about. 

A table would work for a situation like that one, but if someone wants to place the dataset within another table (as I do), it becomes a series of nested complications, which are tricky to sort out in the Confluence markup. As such, I'm filing this as a bug and not an improvement.
fields.summary: Lack of support for Tab Characters

fields.description:
When pages are exported into PDF, the page are ordered by the creation date (or id?) and not according to the page tree or alphabetic order. Makes for a very confusing read when printed.

CONF-1031 details this but I'm creating a new issue since the other report is kind of vague and contains a lot of other proposals.
fields.summary: Pages are exported in creation, not alphabetic order
